author: ayaxlabombarda
title: Innovatio Digital HUB
description: Physical HUBs limit the participation of community members in specific cities and local spaces, leaving many digital users outside.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the key problem of limitations of physical hubs and provides a digital solution to encourage public mass adoption with a focus on early adopters. This is excellent and directly responds to the challenge of getting the average person to participate in Cardano. The other elements of this proposal which clearly align with the challenge are the fact that it is in keeping with the minimum viable hub principle, provides a path for sustainability and is scalable at very low cost. The proposal KPIs also align with those of the challenge to the extent that it seeks to measure and identify members drawn to their discord channels, number of views and interactions within their social networks as well as number of people who participate in Innovatio activities and can be onboarded. The proposal fully addresses the challenge and clearly earns 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the profiles of the team in the attached pdf document, they have the relevant expertise and experience to successfully implement the proposal. The team also has experience in the Catalyst community and is active in digital spaces. The Innovatio brand started in fund 3 and solidified in fund 6 and have been successfully running the hub on the discord platform for the past three months. Links to their online events have been provided in the proposal. Based on the above, they have a track record of successful proposal implementation. 
The proposal provides clear goals to be achieved including a list of activities, events and social networks to be utilized to achieve these goals. A roadmap detailing what will be done within a specific timeframe would however enhance the feasibility of the proposal and the extent to which progress can be monitored. Also, requested funds for this proposal is $30,000 however totals of the budgeted amounts come up to $27,600. Proposers should kindly rectify this error.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers provide a number of metrics by which progress will be measured and this can be verified from their digital channels. In addition proposers indicate that the Community will be given daily updates to promote community engagement. Reference is made to an actual Workflow document which is supposed to be attached. Unfortunately I have not seen the document among those attached to the proposal or external links

f6_assessments.q0: I have gone through the platform of the team that presents this proposal and the truth is that it is exactly what this challenge seeks. They build community around cardano, push ideas by holding meetups, help people in any way they can, etc. Undoubtedly, the proposal fits here and could contribute a lot.
f6_assessments.q1: As I said before, the team already has a community in development for a long time, in addition to the fact that they are starting a proposal for a crowdfunding platform in Cardano. The team shows that it covers positions in all the necessary areas and the activity they show in the discord community shows that they will easily carry out the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Having a series of kpis with which to contrast the improvement of the project and also seeing that it is an improvement to an already created community, I think it is easy to check if the proposal is carried out as it should. They explain what the success is for the proposal and add what improvements will be implemented.

f6_assessments.q0: Assessing if this proposal addresses the challenge, it must be contemplated that the team already has a community in development thanks to a previous financing, so they will try to scale it in the case of receiving the financing, just what the title of the challenge proposes.
f6_assessments.q1: In the section of experience and plan presented, as I said before, they already have experience in receiving financing and carrying out a project. It also includes a document with information about the entire team (something very important that not all proposals make). With this in mind, I consider the proposal valid for this section.
f6_assessments.q2: Finally taking into account this section, a series of kpis or metrics are usually sought very useful to measure progress. In this case we get a list of metrics. It is also expected that the team will be able to decide what is the success for the proposal and, indeed, they do not forget to include it in the plan. I consider this section complete.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge is to scale communities that have been created around Cardano. Since this community has already been created thanks to a previous fund, this proposal would be the continuation of it so it reflects exactly the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: It seems that for the previous proposal, staff have been hired who work full time to advance with the community, coordinate it and make it grow. In addition, the objectives to improve thanks to this proposal are indicated perfectly so I trust that everything will go according to plan.
f6_assessments.q2: A detailed auditability section is included in which it is specified how the progress of the project will be measured (metrics that can be obtained and compared without any problem) and also explains what the successful result of the project would be. It also includes the proposal on which this same one will be made, which has been financed in fund 6 and we can also see that it is making progress.

f6_assessments.q0: Considering that the proposal seeks to improve a community that is already in full growth in Cardano, this proposal fits perfectly with the challenge. It will also encourage new people to access Cardano giving them a community in which to train and grow.
f6_assessments.q1: Magnificent plan. All well structured and very good ideas to improve the discord community. Each of the contributions to be made in the proposal are very interesting and will surely improve this community. Networking sessions seem to me something that contributes a lot to this community. Also seeing the team that make it up and that in turn are developing more things in cardano sure that this idea will be completed.
f6_assessments.q2: Mainly there is a list of different functions to implement in the community, they also propose some metrics to follow to check the progress and finally explain what is the success for this proposal. Surely it will be audited without problem.

f6_assessments.q0: As can be seen in the proposal, it tries to reinforce a growing community around cardano, share ideas, conduct networking sessions to connect members of the community etc. I affirm that this proposal fits perfectly with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: It is not an isolated and anonymous proposal but they have already been previously financed and it can be seen that these financed projects are in development and are committed to carrying them out. In addition, they have an apparently consolidated team with members for all positions so it will be very feasible that everything is carried out successfully according to what has been proposed.
f6_assessments.q2: In the auditability section of the proposal, 5 metrics are listed with which to measure the development of the proposal that are easily identifiable and highly indicators that the project evolves correctly. In addition, to check if there is a notable success in the proposal, they explain what their purpose is and mention what can be considered as a success.

f6_assessments.q0: Reading through the goals of this proposal, you're in the section on expanding community hubs, and clearly that's the goal of this proposal. There is already a small community created after the proposal and its objective is to expand and improve it.
f6_assessments.q1: It is not a proposal that comes out of nowhere, quite the opposite. The team has already been previously financed in previous funds and if you access their discord community and their social networks you can see that several people are working professionally on it and obtaining results such as networking sessions and much more. Following that path they will achieve what they are proposing this time.
f6_assessments.q2: They provide a list of goals to complete that are a continuation of tasks that are already being carried out. In addition, metrics are provided that can be used to measure progress. All this together allows us to follow the development and success of the proposal.

solution: Develop a digital community for users around the world to increase mass public adoption and participation in blockchain technology.
experience: The Innovatio brand started in Fund 3 and consolidated since Fund 6 with 3 funded proposals, we are a team with experience and background in the Catalyst community and digital spaces, solid teamwork with work done, check external links and PDF.
